qas.question: Along with trusts, what other non-profits are allowed to run schools in India?
What country has the most illiterate adults in the world?
What is the full name of the ASER?
What is the purpose of the ASER?

answers.text: evaluates learning levels in rural India
evaluates learning levels in rural India
evaluates learning levels in rural India

qas.question: In private schools, what language are classes taught in?
Who can legally teach English in India?

plausible_answers.text: satisfy a number of infrastructure and human resource related criteria to get Recognition

qas.question: What do government schools have to do to be able to teach English?
What is happening to the number of government schools in rural India?

plausible_answers.text: unpopularity of government schools and an increasing number of private schools

qas.question: What did the ASER report show about how people feel about private schools?
What does poor academic achievement lead to according to critics?

context: Legally, <b5_0>only non-profit trusts and <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2>societies<b5_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> can run schools in <a1_0><a1_1>India<a1_1/><a1_0/>. They will have to <b6_0>satisfy a number of infrastructure and human resource related criteria to get Recognition<b6_0/> (a form of license) from the government. Critics of this system point out that this leads to <b9_0>corruption<b9_0/> by school inspectors who check compliance and to fewer schools in a country that has the largest adult illiterate population in the world. While official data does not capture the real extent of private schooling in the country, various studies have reported <b8_0>unpopularity of government schools and an <b7_0>increasing<b7_0/> number of private schools<b8_0/>. The <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2>Annual Status of Education Report<a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> (ASER), which <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2>evaluates learning levels in rural <a1_2>India<a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/><a1_2/>, has been reporting poorer academic achievement in government schools than in private schools. A key difference between the government and private schools is that the medium of education in private schools is <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2>English<a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> while it is the local language in government schools.
